image.altText: flying foxes in commonwealth park

props.synopsis: The skies above Lake Burley Griffin are pretty vast. But potentially not vast enough to leave enough space for flying foxes and drones to travel across it at the same time.

title.children: Fears for flying foxes prompt change to Canberra drone show timing

image.altText: A concrete building with lettering above the entrance reading "Law Courts of the Australian Capital Territory".

props.synopsis: The doctor is facing 20 charges against four women, including rape, assault, committing acts of indecency and using a carriage service to harass.

title.children: Canberra doctor accused of sexually assaulting four women refused bail

image.altText: Some shrubs in the foreground near a KFC restaurant, with striking red architecture.

props.synopsis: The woman's employer has been ordered by the ACT Civil and Administrative Tribunal to pay her $90,000.

title.children: KFC manager told to express breastmilk in toilet wins payout

image.altText: Lauren Anthes

props.synopsis: For more than a decade, women walking into the abortion clinic in Queanbeyan have been greeted by Annie Collins, but the manager of Gynaecology Centres Australia's Queanbeyan clinic fears her days supporting women through surgical abortions could be numbered.

title.children: The unintended consequence of free abortions in the ACT

image.altText: police car

props.synopsis: The man was refused bail when he appeared in the ACT Magistrates Court and has been remanded in custody.

title.children: Man charged after allegedly severing neighbour's finger with sword

image.altText: The exterior of a building with NDIS signage prominently displayed on the outside. Location is not specific.

props.synopsis: A record fine has been handed down to an NDIS service provider after a man choked and died in its care.

title.children: NDIS provider given record fine after man died choking on sandwich

image.altText: Kathryn holds up her x-ray and looks at it. It looks like the harbour bridge from a bird's eye view.

props.synopsis: Bone is the most transplanted tissue after blood but bone banks are constantly short of donors, with only 10 per cent of people who have hip replacements opting-in to donate.

title.children: Most don't donate bone from hip replacement despite not changing surgery

image.altText: A photo of a person in an online meeting with the person's head is blurred.

props.synopsis: The explanation was questioned by one federal MP who said there is "no such thing as a superficial Nazi salute".

title.children: ANU says students did not make anti-Semitic gestures during online meeting

image.altText: a man in a murky lake

props.synopsis: It's not all algae and ducks in Lake Burley Griffin, as this open water swimmer will tell you.

title.children: Joseph swims weekly in Lake Burley Griffin, but he knows the dangers

props.synopsis: Evacuation orders are lifted for thousands of Californians, while new blazes ignite in the city of San Diego and on the Mexico border and a red flag emergency warning for critical fire risk is extended.

title.children: Progress made on LA fires as evacuation orders lift

image.altText: A conical cloud over farmland.

props.synopsis: Meteorologists have dismissed speculation that a tornado touched down on Queensland's Western Downs during a severe thunderstorm on Thursday.

title.children: No tornado, but raging Queensland storm had funnel-cloud twist

image.altText: The PM with a face mask

props.synopsis: It's been about five years since the first case of COVID-19 was confirmed in Australia. This is what Australia living through "unprecedented times" looks like in numbers.

title.children: COVID-19 hit Australia five years ago. These numbers show its impact

image.altText: A team of six people stand behind a man in a hospital bed

props.synopsis: A Lithuanian national whose leg was amputated during an emergency medical extraction from Tasmania's remote wilderness will soon return home after a two-month recovery.

title.children: Man who had leg amputated on Franklin River rafting trip to return home

image.altText: The Purdue Pharma branded logo seen on the side of a grey building roof

props.synopsis: The pharmaceutical company's owners have agreed to pay US7.4 billion ($11.7 billion) and relinquish ownership of the company.

title.children: Purdue Pharma to pay billions to settle OxyContin crisis lawsuit

image.altText: A crocodile entering the water at a beach.

props.synopsis: One resident captured a video of the crocodile entering the water after seeing it lying in the middle of the beach, which is a popular camping and fishing spot.

title.children: Shocked beachgoers report crocodile lying on sand only 350km north of Brisbane

image.altText: Anthony Albanese calls for reform and renewal in the health and education sectors

props.synopsis: Two more states have agreed to sign on to the federal government's new school funding agreement, which will see the Commonwealth lift its share of public school funding to 25 per cent.

title.children: Significant progress to ending the school funding wars as two more states sign on

image.altText: A close up of Jack Schlossberg speaking, with his right hand over his heart

props.synopsis: Jack Schlossberg, John F Kennedy's only grandson, has slammed Donald Trump's decision to declassify documents relating to the late president's assassination, saying JFK is being used as a "political prop".

title.children: Jack Schlossberg slams Trump over release of JFK assassination records

image.altText: Carl Ditterich leaving court

props.synopsis: Victorian prosecutors have dropped a sexual assault case against Australian Rules great Carl Ditterich, who was due to stand trial in the County Court.

title.children: Sexual assault charges against former VFL player Carl Ditterich dropped

image.altText: A Facebook photo of former professional cyclist Melissa Hoskins.

props.synopsis: Loved ones of Olympic cyclist Melissa Hoskins will be given the chance to deliver victim impact statements at the next court appearance of Rohan Dennis, who last month pleaded guilty over the incident which resulted in his wife's death.

title.children: Court anticipates victim impact statements following death of Melissa Hoskins

props.synopsis: Around the clock coverage of news events as they break at home and abroad.

title.children: ABC News Channel live

image.altText: A single firefigher is seen next to a small collection of flames next to a dirt road.

props.synopsis: Emergency services contain a bushfire threatening lives and homes in Western Australia's Wheatbelt.

title.children: Northam bushfire downgraded as firefighters douse flames

image.altText: First responders on the scene of a crash, where a damaged police vehicle can be seen.

props.synopsis: A highway patrol officer has been seriously injured in a collision with a truck south-west of Brisbane.

title.children: Highway patrol officer seriously injured in crash south-west of Brisbane

image.altText: A woman, with a panicked expression on her face, holds two children.

props.synopsis: A video of Shiri Bibas and her two young children being kidnapped on October 7 made headlines around the world. Hamas says they've been killed, but many Israeli's don't believe them, and the tragic mystery will likely soon be solved.

title.children: The video shocked the world, and now Israelis are holding their breath

image.altText: Alex Cullen smiling, wearing a black suit and bow tie with a white button-up shirt.

props.synopsis: Today hosts Karl Stefanovic and Sarah Abo addressed the journalist's absence on air this morning, telling viewers he would "finish with the network".

title.children: Nine's Alex Cullen to leave Today show over 'Lambo guy' controversy

image.altText: Baby Penguin sitting in a burrow

props.synopsis: A sudden drop in adult little penguin numbers at Bicheno on Tasmania's east coast has led to alarm for the fate of the colony as penguin chicks reliant on parents are seen dying.

title.children: Tours cancelled as adult penguins fail to return to young at seaside town

image.altText: Camp dog sits on the porch of a house.

props.synopsis: A group of remote public housing tenants have lost an appeal against a Northern Territory government policy they say tripled their rent.

title.children: Remote NT residents lose appeal in '200 per cent' rent rise lawsuit

image.altText: Alice Bacon was among the 19 Newmarch House aged care facility residents that  died from COVID-19.

props.synopsis: During the 65-day outbreak at Newmarch House in Kingswood, in Sydney's west, 37 of the 97 residents contracted COVID-19 from April to June 2020.

title.children: COVID spread at Sydney aged care home could have been slowed, inquest finds

image.altText: An aerial photo of semi-rural land with some cattle and green paddocks, and scattered buildings.

props.synopsis: The NSW planning commission has rejected a Moss Vale plastics recycling facility after receiving nearly 3,000 submissions from opposers, including high-profile celebrities and a billionaire.

title.children: Residents' relief as controversial plastics recycling plant rejected

image.altText: Bryan Coquard points to his chest as he finishes ahead of Jhonatan Narvaez

props.synopsis: Bryan Coquard out-sprinted a reduced bunch to claim a dramatic victory into Victor Harbor on stage four of the Tour Down Under, as Javier Romo saw his lead at the top of the general classification cut.

title.children: Tour Down Under 'all to play for' as Frenchman claims furious sprint win

image.altText: A satellite image of a large, four-sided iceberg surrounded by ice and water coloured mostly in white

props.synopsis: The slab of ice — named A23a — weighs almost one trillion tonnes and could slam into South Georgia Island before either getting stuck or being guided around the land by currents.

title.children: World's biggest iceberg drifting towards penguin-packed island

image.altText: Mark Zuckerberg, Jeff Bezos, Sundar Pichai and Elon Musk standing on a stage

props.synopsis: There’s no official ruling on the collective noun for a group of billionaires, but if ever we needed one it was this week, writes Ange Lavoipierre.

title.children: How the new 'tech oligarchy' under Donald Trump will reshape the world

image.altText: cctv image of two people dressed in black hoodies one on a bike outside a synagogue in newtown

props.synopsis: Several red swastikas were also graffitied along the front fence of the Newtown Synagogue on January 11.

title.children: Second man charged over alleged attempt to set fire to Sydney synagogue

image.altText: Two people smiling at camera with dog in between

props.synopsis: Two sets of walking shoes, sunscreen, dehydrated food and a rain and wind-proof jacket are some of the items Elise Smith packed for her assistance dog Lenny, who joined her for a 65-kilometre trek in Tasmania.

title.children: How Elise's small and fluffy assistance dog made a six-day hike possible

image.altText: Police tape in the foreground with trees and car in the background

props.synopsis: Detectives from the Child Protection Investigation Unit and specialist police from Crime and Intelligence Command's Child Trauma Unit are investigating the death of a two-month-old girl.

title.children: Two-month-old baby girl dies in Brisbane hospital after suffering 'life-threatening injuries'

image.altText: Karla Sofía Gascón walking through a public space with a bag on her shoulder.

props.synopsis: Trans actress Karla Sofía Gascón makes Oscars history, an Australian cinematographer heading for gold and more from today's Academy Award nominations

title.children: All the snubs, surprises and successes in the 2025 Oscar nominations
